articles.author: Gleb Garanich, Andriy Perun
articles.description: Russia launched missiles and drones on Kyiv and the western Ukrainian city of Lviv, not far from the border with NATO-member Poland, Ukraine's military said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia launches air attacks on Kyiv, western city of Lviv, Ukraine says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed 33 Palestinians across Gaza in the past 24 hours as they battled Hamas-led militants, Palestinian officials said on Tuesday, but brief pauses in fighting allowed medics to conduct a third day of polio vaccinations for children.
articles.title: Israeli attacks in Gaza kill 33 Palestinians but pauses allow third day of polio vaccinations

articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Stefanno Sulaiman
articles.description: Pope Francis on Wednesday urged political leaders in Indonesia, the world's most populous Muslim-majority country, to guard against religious extremism, which he said distorted people's religious beliefs through "deception and violence".
articles.title: Pope Francis, in Muslim-majority Indonesia, warns against religious extremism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States announced criminal charges on Tuesday against Hamas' top leaders over their roles in planning, supporting and perpetrating the deadly Oct. 7 attack in southern Israel.
articles.title: US charges Hamas leaders over Oct. 7 attack on Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A former aide to New York Governor Kathy Hochul has been charged with acting as an undisclosed agent of the Chinese government, federal prosecutors in Brooklyn said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Ex-aide to NY Governor Hochul charged with acting as Chinese agent

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 41 people were killed and more than 180 wounded on Tuesday when Russia hit a military institute in the central town of Poltava, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said, in one of the deadliest single strikes of the war.
articles.title: Russian missile strike kills 41 people in Ukraine's Poltava, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Around 8,000 Rohingya Muslims have fled to Bangladesh in recent months, escaping escalating violence in Myanmar's western Rakhine state, according to Bangladeshi officials.
articles.title: Thousands of Rohingya flee to Bangladesh from violence in Myanmar, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump said in a court filing on Tuesday that he would plead not guilty to criminal charges in a revised indictment accusing him of attempting to overturn his 2020 election defeat.
articles.title: Trump to plead not guilty to charges in revised US indictment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand's King Maha Vajiralongkorn on Wednesday endorsed Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra's new cabinet, the Royal Gazette showed.
articles.title: Thailand's king endorses PM's new cabinet, Royal Gazette shows

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The Ukrainian minister who oversees domestic arms production resigned on Tuesday in anticipation of another defence role, and two other ministers stood down, in a government shakeup at a critical juncture during the war with Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine arms chief, two ministers resign in government shake-up
